title: First mobile tower erected at remote CRPF base in Chhattisgarh's Sukma
content: First mobile tower in Naxal-hit Sukma district provides connectivity to remote villages, aiding anti-Maoist operations and development efforts

title: BJP Tamil Nadu chief Annamalai accuses DMK government of not taking action against mineral smuggling
content: “The entire Tamil Nadu has been looted for its mineral resources, since the DMK came to power. The looting is solely being carried out by the members of the DMK,” Mr. Annamalai said

title: TVK chief Vijay demands fair investigation in alleged financial irregularities in Tasmac
content: Raising doubts on whether there will be a fair investigation on the issue, Mr. Vijay, once again, indirectly accused the BJP and the DMK of having a secret alliance

title: Union Minister Vaishnaw announces development of Hyperloop electronics tech at ICF Chennai
content: After his visit to the Hyperloop testing facility at IIT Madras’ Thaiyur campus, Mr. Vaishnaw said the 410-meter-long Hyperloop test tube is the longest of its kind in Asia

title: Vizianagaram Municipal Corporation forms 50 special teams for collection of property tax
content: The special teams focussed on shops and commercial complexes for the collection of property tax along with arrears

title: Constable posted as security guard of Tej Pratap sent to police lines for dancing in uniform
content: The RJD leader found himself at the centre of a fresh controversy on Saturday (March 15, 2025) when the constable was commanded by the former Bihar Minister to perform a 'thumka' (pelvic thrust) or face suspension

title: Renowned Odia poet Ramakanta Rath dies at 90
content: Odisha CM Mohan Charan Majhi said Ramakanta Rath will always be remembered for his contribution to the Indian administrative service and to the world of literature

title: BJP declares three candidates for Maharashtra council bypolls
content: The by-elections have been necessitated owing to the victory of the five sitting MLCs in the November 2024 Assembly polls

title: News in Frames: City of a goddess
content: Waves of women fill the streets of Thiruvananthapuram on the day of Pongala, a ritual to propitiate the mother goddess with offerings cooked in lines and lines of streetside basic hearths

title: Hugs and smiles as Nasa crew reaches ISS to bring back Sunita Williams, Butch Wilmore
content: SpaceX's Crew Dragon capsule successfully docked with the ISS, bringing much-needed relief to astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore after being stranded in orbit for over nine months. The Crew-10 team, consisting of astronauts from Nasa, JAXA, and Roscosmos, has arrived to replace them and take over their duties.

title: BLA claims mass execution of 214 Pakistan train hijack hostages
content: The Baloch Liberation Army (BLA) claimed responsibility for the execution of 214 hostages after Pakistan refused to negotiate a prisoner exchange. The mass execution included only Pakistan security personnel, contrasting with the Pak army's claim that 26 hostages were killed. The BLA also acknowledged losing 12 militants, including five suicide attackers, during the incident.

title: Bihar cop removed after dancing to Tej Pratap Yadav’s 'dance or be suspended' order
content: A Bihar police constable, Deepak Kumar, has been removed from duty after a video showed him dancing on RJD leader Tej Pratap Yadav's orders during Holi celebrations. The incident has sparked political outcry, with opposition leaders condemning Yadav's behavior as reminiscent of RJD's past conduct.

title: Who was Abu Qatal? Key Lashkar-e-Taiba operative killed in Pakistan
content: Abu Qatal, a prominent Lashkar-e-Taiba operative, also known as Faisal Nadeem, was killed by unidentified assailants in Jhelum Sindh, Pakistan. He was a significant target for Indian security agencies due to his involvement in major terrorist attacks in Jammu and Kashmir, including the Rajouri and Reasi attacks.

title: 'Ties hands, drowns them': Father kills 2 sons, ends life over ‘kids’ bleak future'
content: In Kakinada, a man killed his two young sons due to fears about their future in a competitive world and then hanged himself. Financially stable, he left a note explaining his concerns. The family celebrated Holi before the tragic event occurred. The man's wife found their bodies at home after returning from the office.

title: Tesla investor shares Tesla's 10 Biggest shareholders, Elon Musk responds with a ...
content: Elon Musk, the largest shareholder of Tesla, responded positively to a Twitter post revealing the top 10 shareholders of the company, with Musk topping the list at $173 billion. Additionally, US President Donald Trump recently purchased a Tesla Model S to show his support for Musk's electric vehicle initiative.

title: 'Hell will rain down': US strikes Houthi rebels in Yemen, 31 killed
content: At least 31 people have been killed in large-scale US military strikes on Yemen's Houthi rebels, ordered by President Trump. The attacks were a response to the Houthis' targeting of Red Sea shipping routes, with Trump warning Iran to stop supporting the Houthis.

title: Missing Indian student Sudiksha's clothes found on beach chair
content: Authorities found clothing at the beach believed to belong to missing University of Pittsburgh student Sudiksha Konanki. She vanished over a week ago during a spring break trip in Punta Cana. Surveillance footage showed her with Joshua Riibe, who is now a person of interest. The investigation continues, and Dominican officials have intensified efforts to find Konanki.

title: US intelligence chief Tulsi Gabbard arrives in India to attend key Delhi meet
content: US Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard visits India following PM Modi's trip to the US. Modi and Gabbard discussed India-US relations, with Gabbard expressing her commitment to strengthening ties. This visit follows Modi’s meeting with President Trump after Trump's second term in office began, highlighting the continuing diplomatic engagement between the two nations.

title: Infosys cofounder Narayana Murthy: Somehow it has become a fashion in India to ...
content: NR Narayana Murthy, co-founder of Infosys, addressed the hype around AI in India, stating that many systems are just traditional programming. He emphasized that genuine AI involves machine learning and deep learning, which can greatly enhance human-like capabilities.

title: 'Voice of America' funding cut; staff on administrative leave
content: The Trump administration has cut operations for US government-funded media, placing all Voice of America staff on leave. The decision affects over 1,300 employees and has been criticized by press advocacy groups for threatening the US's role in promoting free information globally.

title: 'Nobody can save you': Actor 'molested' by co-star during Holi party in Mumbai
content: Amboli Police have filed an FIR against an actor after a TV actress accused him of molestation during a Holi party on March 14. The intoxicated actor allegedly groped her and forcibly smeared color on her face, despite her resistance, leading her to seek police action.

title: Five policemen injured in mob attack in Bihar's Bhagalpur
content: The incident happened in Antichak in Kahalgaon sub-division on Saturday (March 15, 2025) night when a police team went there after receiving information about a fight between two groups

title: More than six lakh students to take Class X Board Examinations from March 17 in Andhra Pradesh
content: As many as 163 exam centres have been identified as ‘problematic’ centres and CC cameras have been installed; APSRTC Kurnool has announced free ride in some specific bus services for the students taking the SSC examinations

title: Teacher ends life in Beed; leaves behind note alleging harassment
content: The deceased, identified as Dhananjay Nagargoje, worked at an unaided ashram (residential) school in Kelgaon area of Beed for the past 18 years

title: Fire in Gwalior hospital, over 190 patients rescued
content: No casualty was reported; over 190 patients, including 13 from the ICU, were rescued and shifted to another hospital, officials said

title: Rosmerta Digital seeks initiation of insolvency proceedings against Ola Electric's subsidiary
content: The insolvency proceedings come at a time when Ola Electric Mobility is cutting around 1,000 jobs across different functions as part of a restructuring exercise to reduce losses.

title: Amit Shah to chair key meet with CMs of Northeast States
content: Amit Shah spent the Saturday (March 15, 2025) night in Mizoram where he attended a programme of the Assam Rifles.

title: CM Mohan Yadav reacts to Madhya Pradesh mob attack; confirms death of police personnel
content: CM Mohan Yadav also said that instructions have been issued to take strict action against those responsible

title: Whitewashing of Jama Masjid in Sambhal underway
content: The Allahabad High Court on March 12 directed the Archaeological Survey of India to undertake and complete the whitewashing at the mosque within one week

title: A gig that provides, and traps
content: Operating in the informal grey zone between convenience and flexibility, the emergent category of labour force, called gig workers, finds itself trapped in the very flexibility that allows it to operate. It is a job when jobs are difficult to come by and it pays, but the gig workers face long hours, poor pay, unsafe conditions, and hardly any legal or social security protection, as Geetha Srimathi finds out

title: What’s on the agenda of the Raisina Dialogue?
content: Who are the newsmakers attending the 10th edition this year? Will Ukraine war, tariffs threatened by U.S. President Donald Trump, relations with China dominate proceedings? Why are leaders from West Asia and South East Asia not well represented? What about Pakistan?

title: Why has India got another tiger reserve?
content: Where is Madhav National Park located? What is its tiger population? What are the factors under consideration before a national park can become a designated tiger reserve? What is the tiger population in the country according to the 2023 tiger census?

title: Appeasement politics of Congress will weaken national unity: BJP
content: BJP spokesperson Ravi Shankar Prasad asserts that the Siddaramaiah govt. in Karnataka took an ‘unconstitutional’ decision of providing 4% quota to Muslims in govt. contracts on the instructions of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi

title: BJP questions move by Telangana Govt. to include foreign economist in expert group to analyse caste survey data
content: The Congress govt. has roped in French economist Thomas Piketty as part of an 11-member committee for analysing the caste survey data; BJP asks if the ruling party does not trust Indian experts

title: Close aide of Hafiz Saeed gunned down: LeT terrorist Abu Qatal killed in Pakistan
content: A top Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorist, Abu Qatal, known for his involvement in numerous attacks in Jammu and Kashmir, was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Pakistan's Jhelum Sindh. Qatal, a close aide of Hafiz Saeed, recently led proxy terror outfits PAFF and TRF to conceal activities of other terror groups.

title: Zuckerberg likely to be questioned for 7 hours in case filed during Trump's first term
content: Facebook-parent Meta anticipates FTC scrutiny with top executives, including CEO Mark Zuckerberg, set to testify in an antitrust trial. The FTC aims to reverse Meta's acquisition of Instagram and WhatsApp, asserting Meta's dominance in the social media industry could be unlawful.

title: Rescue mission turns deadly: ASI, hostage lynched by mob in MP
content: A rescue operation in MP's Mauganj district turned deadly as a mob killed a hostage, Sunny Dwivedi, and an assistant sub-inspector. The chaos erupted when villagers, believing Sunny was responsible for an earlier death, became violent after discovering he had died during captivity. Several policemen were injured during the incident.

title: Music director AR Rahman hospitalised in Chennai following chest discomfort
content: AR Rahman, the celebrated Indian composer, was admitted to Apollo Hospital in Chennai due to chest discomfort. Doctors performed an angioplasty, and he is under observation. The music fraternity and his fans are deeply concerned and hoping for his swift recovery.

title: India celebrates 13 years of Tendulkar's 100 hundreds
content: Sachin Tendulkar achieved a significant milestone 13 years ago by scoring his 100th international century during the India vs Bangladesh ODI in 2012. His century tally includes 51 in Tests and 49 in ODIs. Despite his remarkable effort, India lost the match by five wickets.

title: 'Dance or be suspended': Tej Pratap Yadav reacts to backlash over remark to cop
content: Former Bihar minister Tej Pratap Yadav faces backlash for his "dance or be suspended" remark to a policeman during Holi celebrations. BJP leaders and retired police officers criticize the RJD leader, accusing him of disrespecting the police force and reviving the era of "Jungle Raj" in Bihar.

title: Ranya Rao's dad, an officer of DGP rank, sent on forced leave
content: Kannada actor Ranya Rao was caught smuggling 14.2 kg gold at Bengaluru airport. Her father, DGP Ramachandra Rao, has been sent on 'compulsory leave' to avoid embarrassment. Three central agencies are investigating, with Rao's involvement denied by Ranya, who claims she was coerced into signing documents. The central agencies might summon Rao for questioning.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for next week
content: Stock market recommendations: Bajaj Broking Research recommends Piramal Pharma and PTC India for the upcoming week. Nifty is expected to remain volatile, with key support at 22,000-21,700 levels.

title: Sunita & Butch welcome their newly arrived replacements to space station
content: A SpaceX crew capsule successfully docked at the ISS, bringing in a new team to replace two Nasa astronauts who have been stranded for over nine months. Technical issues with their Boeing vehicle delayed their return, but they are now scheduled to go back to Earth on a SpaceX capsule by mid-March.

title: Whitewashing of Sambhal mosque begins after Allahabad high court order
content: Whitewashing of Sambhal Jama Masjid began following an Allahabad high court order. The court allowed decorative lighting without structural modifications. The mosque gained attention after a local court's survey order led to unrest in November 2024. The dispute involved claims the mosque was built over an ancient temple. Clashes occurred, raising debates around the Places of Worship Act, 1991.

title: Trump's 18th century law for speedy deportations blocked by district judge
content: A federal judge halted the Trump administration's deportation of Venezuelan gang members, blocking the use of an old law for fast-tracking. The Alien Enemies Act of 1798 was invoked by Trump but faced legal challenges, leading to a temporary order stopping deportations for 14 days.

title: 'Illegal' homes razed after mob wrecks havoc in Gujarat's Vastral
content: Authorities in Ahmedabad demolished illegally constructed houses of six out of 14 accused involved in a mob attack at Vastral. The mob, armed with sticks and swords, vandalized vehicles and injured three people. The demolished houses were located in Amraiwadi and Khokhar localities.

title: Virat Kohli: 'To be Olympic champions would be a magnificent feeling'
content: Virat Kohli says he's not playing for "achievement" anymore but for the joy and excitement; admits retirement call will be tough because of "competitive Streak"

title: 32-year-old constable booked for ‘repeatedly raping’ female SI in Dehradun
content: A 32-year-old constable in Dehradun allegedly raped a female sub-inspector multiple times, blackmailing her with a video of the first assault. The constable booked a hotel room for her and then attacked her. The victim reported the crime, and an investigation is ongoing.

title: Uninterrupted storytelling: a lone woman’s toil to take books to the masses through audios
content: Story-teller Ramya Vasudevan keeps piling up audio stories through a disciplined schedule of recordings

title: Tuhin Kanta Pandey | Market watchdog
content: The new SEBI chief says his focus will be on optimum regulation, not on maximum regulation, as he seeks to ensure fair practices at India’s security’s markets

title: ‘Two additional electronics manufacturing clusters to come up at ₹1,112 cr. in T.N.’
content: Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said that the Railway budget for Tamil Nadu has increased many times since the UPA II regime and stands at more than 6000 crore

title: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Stalin calls for intervention by the judiciary to protect federalism
content: Stressing the need for ensuring the autonomy of the States, Mr. Stalin said the Tamil Nadu government has been striving for protection of the Constitutional values during challenging times in the country with a diversity of culture

title: One killed, multiple police personnel injured in Madhya Pradesh as clashes between groups turn violent
content: A government official, present at the spot, said that the dispute broke out over a road accident more than a month ago in which a man had passed away

title: New Delhi stampede: Two out of five transferred Railway officials get posting in NR Headquarter
content: Railway sources said that a high-level inquiry is underway to fix the accountability of those whose negligence led to the tragedy

title: Dharwad gets soaked in myriad colours
content: The soaring temperature didnot deter the holi celebrations on Saturday as the cultural city Dharwad got soaked in myriad colours with people of all age groups from toddlers to senior citizens came out in large numbers to celebrate the festival of colours.

title: Watch: Serbia sees one of the largest anti-govt protests over Vucic’s 11-year rule
content: A massive student-led protest in Belgrade challenges President Aleksandar Vučić’s 11-year rule, accusing him of autocratic governance. The demonstrations, sparked by a deadly railway station collapse, demand honest governance and an end to corruption. Government measures to limit protest size did not deter participants.

title: Canada to review purchase of US-made F-35 fighter jets for 'better options'
content: Canada's new Prime Minister Mark Carney has directed the defense ministry to review the F-35 fighter jet purchase agreement to ensure it is the best investment for the country. The contract, signed under Justin Trudeau's administration, involved 88 F-35s for CAD 19 billion.

title: 31 killed in US strikes as Trump orders military action against Houthi rebels in Yemen
content: At least 31 people, including children, were killed in US airstrikes on Houthi-held regions in Yemen, ordered by President Trump. The strikes follow Houthi threats to Red Sea shipping. The Houthis vowed to respond and accused the US of escalating aggression. Trump warned further attacks if the Houthis continue their actions.

title: Man who posed as Oman envoy is ex-MLA's brother, a well-known zoology professor
content: Krishna Shekhar Rana, a former vice-chancellor and well-known academic, was arrested for impersonating the 'high commissioner' of Oman using forged letterheads and a fake diplomatic vehicle. Despite an impressive academic background and no evidence of monetary gain, Rana faced arrest when security requests exposed inconsistencies, highlighting his attempt to create an illusion of power.

title: Blast at Amritsar temple triggers political uproar across Punjab
content: A grenade attack on Amritsar's Thakur Dwara temple has led opposition leaders to demand accountability from the Punjab government. Partap Singh Bajwa called for the resignation of Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann. BJP's Tarun Chugh and Punjab Congress President Amrinder Singh Raja Warring also criticized the government's handling of security. The Shiromani Akali Dal called for a judicial inquiry.

title: Former Red Wings player Bobby Ryan was once arrested after shoplifting attempt at Nashville airport
content: Bobby Ryan, former NHL player, faced controversy in 2022 after being arrested for attempting to shoplift at Nashville International Airport. Struggling with alcohol addiction, Ryan publicly acknowledged his relapse. Despite his buyout ending with the Detroit Red Wings in 2024, he shifted to podcasting but later parted ways over controversial posts.

title: Amit Shah gifts guitar to Mizoram's 7-year-old singing sensation
content: Union home minister Amit Shah gifted a guitar to seven-year-old Mizoram singing prodigy Esther Lalduhawmi Hnamte after she performed Vande Mataram in Aizawl. Shah expressed his admiration on social media, highlighting her patriotic spirit. Shah's visit also included attending the Assam Rifles' land transfer ceremony to the Mizoram government.

title: 'Shinde wanted to join Congress': Raut claims, Sena calls it 'bhang talk'
content: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut claimed that deputy chief minister Eknath Shinde attempted to join the Congress, sparking controversy. Raut mentioned early morning meetings with late Congress leader Ahmed Patel, while Congress leaders denied knowledge of the matter. Shinde's party dismissed these claims, asserting Raut's statements lack importance, and the BJP emphasized state development as their priority.

title: 'Chhaava' day 30: Vicky Kaushal’s film beats John Abraham’s ‘The Diplomat’
content: Vicky Kaushal’s ‘Chhaava’ continues to perform well at the box office, collecting Rs. 8 crore on its fifth Saturday, bringing its total to Rs 554.75 Cr. The film, based on the life of Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj, has been boosted by the Holi weekend.

title: Govt trashes Pak bids to pin Baloch attack on India, rake up J&K at UN
content: India strongly rejected Pakistan's baseless allegations of Indian involvement in the Balochistan train hijack, asserting the world knows Pakistan is the epicenter of global terrorism. India also reaffirmed Jammu & Kashmir as an integral part of India, criticizing Pakistan's cross-border terrorism.

title: US invokes '1798 Alien Enemy Act' for mass deportations—what it means
content: President Trump invoked the Alien Enemies Act of 1798, claiming a Venezuelan gang invasion, to accelerate deportations of undocumented immigrants. A federal judge halted the deportation of five Venezuelans, prompting legal challenges. This act, used historically during wartime, grants the president significant powers but faces scrutiny when used outside wartime contexts.

title: I don't bring religion & caste into my public discourse: Gadkari
content: Union minister Nitin Gadkari emphasized his belief in service to society over religion or caste in public matters, even at the risk of losing elections or ministerial positions. Speaking at a minority institute’s convocation, he highlighted the transformative power of education, citing his support for the Anjuman-e-Islam institute and the success of its students.

title: Bombay HC allows 26-yr-old to terminate 35-week pregnancy over fetal anomaly
content: Bombay High Court permits a 26-year-old woman to medically terminate her over-35-week pregnancy due to fetal anomaly. The fetus suffers from congenital macrocephaly with severe potential complications, making it "incompatible with life." The decision follows a medical board's unanimous recommendation and aligns with the 2018 guidelines for terminations beyond 20 weeks.

title: Form government without Fadnavis: Patole woos Shinde and Ajit
content: Nana Patole, former Maharashtra Congress chief, extended a political invite to deputy CMs Eknath Shinde and Ajit Pawar, suggesting they form a government without CM Devendra Fadnavis if they feel constrained under his leadership. This adds to speculation about discord within Maharashtra's ruling coalition. Despite controversy, Patole remarked the invitation was in light spirits due to Holi.

title: Work pressure, verbal abuse discouraging doctors from taking up promotions, says govt. doctors’ body
content: Health Minister expresses concern over many associate professors and civil surgeons rejecting the offer to be promoted as professors and DCHSs

title: Facebook hired ‘ex-police captain’ in India for potential imprisonment, new book claims
content: At a time when Facebook was having trouble with law enforcement and government authorities outside the U.S., the company hired an ‘ex-police captain’ in India to go to jail on the company’s behalf in case of a clash between the company and the government, a new book alleges

title: Justice Joymalya Bagchi to be sworn in as SC judge on March 17
content: Once Justice Bagchi takes oath, the Supreme Court will have 33 judges against its sanctioned strength of 34

title: Tensions rise in Maharashtra over demand to demolish Aurangzeb’s tomb
content: The district administration has prohibited Milind Ekbote and his supporters from entering Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar district from March 16 to April 5

title: Two mega defence deals with France await clearance by Cabinet Committee on Security
content: The Navy is keen that the agreements for 26 Rafale-M fighter jets and three more Scorpene-class conventional submarines, worth a total of $11 billion, be inked this financial year

title: Girls dominate WAVES-2025 Young Filmmakers Challenge
content: Chaitanya Chinchlikar of Whistling Woods International said over 1,000 entries were received from close to 80 cities and towns across the country

title: Entire border with Myanmar to be fenced in ten years, say government officials
content: The proposal has faced stiff opposition from Naga and Kuki-Zo bodies, who have objected to the fencing saying it will disrupt ethnic and familial ties for people living on both sides of the border

title: The broadcasting services regulation bill: A threat to digital freedom and innovation
content: The bill’s too expansive measures, which could potentially subject even independent content creators to governmental scrutiny, are among its most controversial features

title: Eknath Shinde wanted to join Congress, says Sanjay Raut
content: Without specifying the timeline, the Shiv Sena (UBT) leader said Shinde had connected with Ahmed Patel, the late Congress leader and political secretary to former Congress president Sonia Gandhi

title: Congress slams Assam CM for the arrest of State spokesperson
content: Congress communication chief Jairam Ramesh, in a post on social media platform X, saying the action was “worse than atrocious”

title: Bengalureans forage for new experiences in their weekend getaways
content: “In the post-pandemic period, people’s interest in things like how their food is grown, the effort involved in farming and activities like sowing and harvesting has increased,” say industry insiders.

title: Supriya Sule slams Bill against urban Naxalism in Maharashtra
content: NCP(SP) MP Supriya Sule said that the Special Public Security Bill, tabled in the Assembly on July 11, 2024, undermines the very concept of “We, the People of India”

title: India’s first ‘frozen zoo’ in Darjeeling with ‘bio-banked’ genetic material
content: India's first frozen zoo in Darjeeling's Padmaja Naidu Himalayan Zoological Park is preserving the DNA of endangered Himalayan species using cryogenic technology. This initiative aims to ensure the long-term preservation of genetic material to aid future conservation efforts, including the possibility of assisted reproduction.

title: Only days spent in India to decide NRI tax status: ITAT
content: Mumbai ITAT ruled in favor of M Gulati, confirming his non-resident status as he spent 210 days abroad. The tribunal clarified that both employment and job search periods abroad qualify for non-residency. This ruling means non-residents are not taxed on overseas income, benefiting expatriates seeking employment abroad.

title: FIR against private univ in Meerut after students offer ‘namaz’ on campus
content: Authorities at a private university in Meerut have registered an FIR against some of its officials after students were seen offering ‘namaz’ on campus without permission. A student and three security guards have been suspended. The university has requested legal action, and police have initiated a probe into the incident.

title: 3 delivery men killed in blaze at Rajkot building sans fire NOC for 10 years
content: Three delivery men died in a Rajkot building fire caused by a suspected electrical short circuit. The 12-storey Atlantis building had failed to renew its fire safety NOC for a decade. Despite notices from the municipal corporation, no action was taken, raising concerns over fire safety enforcement.

title: RBI says IndusInd Bank stable; to fix all discrepencies in seven days
content: The Reserve Bank of India has confirmed that IndusInd Bank is financially stable and adequately capitalised. Depositors are advised not to react to speculation concerning the bank's foreign exchange derivative portfolio discrepancies, which are to be resolved by March 31, 2025. The bank's financial ratios remain solid.

title: Bollywood songs banned in Pakistan colleges
content: Educational authorities in Pakistan's Punjab province officially banned the playing of Indian songs, especially Bollywood hits, in public and private colleges. This move aims to curb 'unethical and vulgar' activities noted by the higher education department during events like sports galas and other functions.

title: Beed Police drop surnames from official name plates to avoid ‘social tension’
content: Due to the deeply political nature of the district, people feel the powerful get the support of the system

title: State govt. releases updated investigation manual for tackling cybercrimes
content: The updated manual integrates the latest trends, tools, and methodologies to combat evolving cyber threats

title: Huge crowds gather to witness ‘Srinivasa Kalyanam’ in Andhra Pradesh’s capital Amaravati
content: TTD performs it in Sri Venkateswara Swamy temple at Venkatapalem; Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu, along with his wife Bhuvaneswari, offers ‘pattu vastrams’ to the deities; 50,000 laddus, 40,000 packets each of ‘pulihora’, ‘ravva kesari’, curd rice and sweets distributed to devotees; vocal concerts by Priya Sisters, Nithyasri Mahadevan and other acclaimed classical singers enthral audience

title: What makes a tribe? Top anthropologists say the answer lies on a spectrum, not in a binary classification
content: This is a paradigm shift in approach from the Centre’s five-point criteria for inclusion in the ST list; a new tool could assess the “degree of tribalness” using a matrix of up to 150 indicators, anthropologists say

title: NHAI tells consultant to revise DPR for elevated highway on Aroor-Edappally NH stretch
content: Aroor-Thuravur elevated NH to be commissioned by February 2026; 55% of the work is completed so far, with 75% expected to be finished by August.

title: TDP leader murdered in Kurnool city
content: Kosapogu Sanjanna, a former Corporator, was waylaid and attacked near his home; his family members who went to his rescue also suffer injuries

title: Eight Madras varsity-affiliated colleges told to postpone graduation day ceremony
content: University held its 166th convocation in September but colleges are yet to distribute degree certificates

title: Surgical specimens lost and found at Thiruvananthapuram Government Medical College Hospital
content: The specimens, preserved in glass jars, were mistakenly taken by a scrap collector who found them left unattended on the steps outside the Pathology department

title: Tariff instability, delayed payment hinder KPTCL’s plans to venture into InvITs
content: InvITs are investment vehicles that allow investors to buy and operate infrastructure projects. The proposal was announced in this year’s budget and it awaits state government approval.

title: Pattikkad-Vilangannur stretch of hill highway opened
content: Public Works P.A. Mohamed Riyas says  the hill highway, funded by KIIFB, is a priority in terms of infrastructure development, with the aim to energise future projects.  The 793-km highway is being developed in phases, with 250 km expected to be completed by 2025

title: IMD predicts hot and humid weather in parts of Andhra Pradesh
content: Maximum temperatures are likely to be above normal by 2 to 4 degree Celsius across North and South Coastal Andhra Pradesh up to March 19

title: Abhishek Banerjee calls for stricter vigil to catch ghosts in Bengal voters’ list
content: The Trinamool leader announced that electoral roll supervisors will be appointed by the party and committees will be set up at the districts, blocks, panchayat, municipalities and booth level

title: Men's Bracketology: The Mountain West will see four teams -- for now
content: Colorado State beat Boise State for the Mountain West title, and automatic bid. This is good news for Indiana.

title: All eyes on top eight teams, top 16 seeds ahead of Selection Sunday and women’s NCAA bracket
content: Where the Nos. 1 and 2 seeds play in the regionals is as big of a question this Selection Sunday as which bubble teams will be in the field.

title: Duke proves 'toughness' minus Flagg to win ACC
content: No. 1 Duke showed off its depth of talent with Cooper Flagg sidelined and defeated 13th-ranked Louisville 73-62 on Saturday night to clinch its second ACC tournament title in three seasons under Jon Scheyer.

title: St. John's wins first Big East tourney since '00
content: The No. 1 seed coming into the tournament played like it all week at Madison Square Garden, as coach Rick Pitino and his St. John's Red Storm secured their first Big East title since 2000, and will head into Selection Sunday on a nine-game winning streak.

title: Vikings acquiring RB Mason in trade with 49ers
content: The Vikings added a young veteran running back to pair with starter Aaron Jones, landing Jordan Mason in a trade with the 49ers.

title: Bickerstaff 'disgusted' by techs in Pistons' loss
content: Detroit's J.B. Bickerstaff blasted the officials after the Pistons were called for five technical fouls in the third quarter of a 113-107 loss to the Oklahoma City Thunder Saturday, telling reporters he was "disgusted by the way that game was officiated."

title: Norris holds off Verstappen in dramatic Aus GP
content: Preseason favourite Lando Norris overcame Max Verstappen, changing weather, a trip across the grass and three safety car periods to win a frenzied Australian Grand Prix.

title: Houston beats 'Zona for Big 12 title, eyes 1-seed
content: Second-ranked Houston turned up its trademark defense in the final minute to hold on for a 72-64 victory over Arizona in the Big 12 tournament championship game Saturday night.

title: Porzingis excels in return from 'frustrating' illness
content: Kristaps Porzingis, who returned after a "frustrating" bout with an illness that kept him out for eight games, scored 24 points in 32 minutes Saturday.

title: ESPN's Vitale gets emotional on ACC broadcast
content: ESPN's Dick Vitale became emotional Saturday night when talking about his most recent cancer battle while announcing Duke's victory over Louisville in the ACC tournament championship.

title: Making sense of QB moves in NFL free agency: We ranked the 10 best fits and answered big questions
content: Sam Darnold to Seattle. Geno Smith to Las Vegas. Aaron Rodgers to ...? Our experts sort through quarterback signings, trades and extensions.

title: Real Madrid won't play without 72 hours' rest
content: Real Madrid's official TV channel have confirmed the team will refuse to play in future if their players aren't given a minimum 72 hours' rest between matches.

title: Pulisic equals career-best goal tally in Milan win
content: Christian Pulisic equaled his career-best goal tally in a single season with his 15th goal of the campaign in AC Milan's 2-1 win over Como on Saturday.

title: USMNT's Haji Wright nets 1st hat trick in England
content: A 26-year-old from Los Angeles, Wright scored in the 21st minute, then converted a penalty kick in the 29th after he was fouled by Chris Mepham. Wright scored in the 73rd for his 10th goal in 19 league matches this season.

title: Pep: Man City face '9 finals' to qualify for UCL
content: While Pep Guardiola and Manchester City are in the unlikeliest of positions having to battle desperately for a Champions League berth next season, the manager did not mince his words in describing the enormity of the challenge.

title: Dele Alli sent off 9 minutes into Como debut
content: Dele Alli's first professional football match in 748 days lasted just nine minutes as he was shown a straight red card for a foul on Ruben Loftus-Cheek.

title: SpaceX Crew Dragon Docks With Space Station To Reach Sunita Williams
content: A pair of astronauts stranded for more than nine months on the International Space Station were a step closer to returning home after a replacement crew docked with the orbital outpost.

title: Live Updates: NASA's Crew-10 Joins Sunita Williams, Butch Wilmore
content: Crew-10 ISS Space Docking Live Updates: NASA and SpaceX launched a crewed mission to the International Space Station to bring home astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore.

title: Trump Warns "Hell Will Rain Down" As US Attacks On Houthis Kill 31
content: At least 31 people were killed as the US launched large-scale strikes on Yemen, with President Donald Trump warning Iran-aligned Houthis that "their time is up". Trump also warned Iran that it needed to "immediately" halt support for the group.

title: Exclusive: AR Rahman Discharged From Hospital - "He Is Absolutely Fine"
content: Earlier today, the musician's spokesperson shared that Rahman felt unwell and went for a check-up last night

title: Missing Indian Student's Clothes Found On Dominican Beach Where She Vanished
content: Sudiksha Konanki, a University of Pittsburgh student, was reported missing around 4 pm on March 6 by her group of five friends with whom she travelled to the Caribbean nation.

title: "Don't Want To Sit Alone And Sulk": Kohli Slams BCCI's 'Family Diktat'
content: Virat Kohli didn't shy away from expressing his disappointment at BCCI's new rule, limiting family's presence during Team India's tours.

title: "Jo Karega Jaat Ki Baat...": Nitin Gadkari's Tough Talk On Caste Politics
content: Expressing his strong views against caste-based politics, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari has said a person's greatness is determined by qualities and not by caste, religion, or gender.

title: Holi Party Turns Violent, Drunk Men Fight Over Comment On Woman, 3 Dead
content: The argument between the six men -- labourers from the same village in Bihar -- turned violent when inappropriate comments were made about a woman.

title: Stranded Astronauts Face Painful Return: Baby Feet, Bone Density Loss And More
content: It is likely that Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore would have developed a host of conditions that would make the acclimatisation process difficult.

title: Maharana Pratap's Descendant, Royal Family Member Arvind Singh Mewar Dies
content: Arvind Singh Mewar (81), a descendant of Rajput king Maharana Pratap, was ill for a long time and under treatment at his residence in City Palace in Udaipur.

title: "Love For Bharat": Amit Shah Praises, Gifts Guitar To Mizoram's "Wonder Kid"
content: Esther Lalduhawmi Hnamte, a young singing sensation from Mizoram, first gained nationwide attention in 2020.

title: What Is Alien Enemies Act, US Law Used For First Time Since World War II
content: US President Donald Trump on Saturday invoked the Alien Enemies Act - a wartime law last used in World War II - to deport individuals linked to Venezuela's Tren de Aragua gang. This was the first use of the act since World War II.

title: Russia's Diplomatic Offensive Ahead Of Raisina Dialogue
content: The salubrious environs of New Delhi's diplomatic landscape, where many subtle messages are exchanged in quiet diplomatic niceties, are suddenly abuzz with something much more direct - and the Russian embassy isn't shy about amplifying it.

title: India's Hyperloop Tube To Be World's Longest At 410 Metres: Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: The 410-meter-long Hyperloop test tube located at IIT Chennai is already the longest Hyperloop test facility in Asia.

title: Wrexham beat promotion rivals Wycombe; go 2nd
content: Wrexham took a huge step towards securing automatic promotion to the Championship with an important 1-0 against Wycombe Wanderers at Adams Park on Saturday.

title: Late Hollerbach goal stuns Bayern in Bundesliga
content: A moment of uncertainty from goalkeeper Jonas Urbig allowed Benedict Hollerbach to score a late goal as Union Berlin secured a 1-1 home draw with Bayern Munich.

title: Mascherano defends handling of Messi fitness
content: Inter Miami head coach Javier Mascherano revealed the team controlled Lionel Messi's fatigue well to avoid any injury.

title: Ronald Acuna Jr. says he'll be more careful this season -- but no one believes him
content: From 40/70 to 40/30? The Braves' 2023 NL MVP is rehabbing with a plan to be stronger -- and healthier.

title: Champions League qualification is the only positive Man City have left -- and they might miss it
content: Man City's awful season could end with one positive: qualification for next season's Champions League. But they are playing so poorly, they might not even get there.

title: One down, three to go: Chelsea on course for quadruple after League Cup win
content: Chelsea's bid to win four trophies was kick-started with a 2-1 win over Man City in the League Cup final.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool to replace Van Dijk with Guéhi
content: Will Marc Guéhi take Virgil van Dijk's spot at the heart of Liverpool's defence? Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Why Geovany Quenda can be Chelsea's answer to Saka
content: Chelsea look set to land the Sporting CP teen in 2026 and Quenda's style has been compared to an Arsenal star.

title: Niemann, Johnson lead LIV Golf Singapore
content: Joaquín Niemann shot a 64 to move up the leaderboard and tie Dustin Johnson for the second-round lead at LIV Golf Singapore.

title: LeBron James watches on as Bryce, Sierra Canyon win state title Friday night
content: The Arizona Wildcats commit finished with 3 points, 5 rebounds and 2 assists as Sierra Canyon (Chatsworth, California) defeated Lincoln (Stockton, California) 58-53 on Friday night.

title: Woman opts for 7-day 'digital custody' over 3-month police custody, loses Rs 34 lakh
content: Mateen Hafeez, special correspondent at The Times of India in Mumbai, reports on terrorism, underworld, cybercrime and organized crime syndicates. He also writes about the jails in Maharashtra and focuses on human interest stories. He has covered the Ghatkopar bomb blast, Vile Parle bomb blast, Mulund train blast, train serial blasts in 2006, 26/11 terror attacks and Pune's German Bakery bomb blast. He has a special interest in Urdu fiction written by Ibn-e-Safi. title: Varun Chakravarthy All But Rules Out Test Call-Up. Explains Why
content: india spinner Varun Charavarthy has opened up on his ambitions of playing Test cricket . the 33-year-old was the X-factor as India clinched the Champions Trophy last week . in three matches, he picked nine wickets, tournament's second best tally after new Zealand's Matt Henry .
